subject: Investing
title: Dividend Yield Explained
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Dividend Yield Explained.

hook.text: Stock A pays $2 per share annually at $100. Stock B pays $2 at $50. Same payment, wildly different yields.

buildup.text: Dividend yield is the annual dividend divided by the stock price, expressed as a percentage.

discovery.text: A 4% yield means you earn $4 annually for every $100 invested, before the stock price even moves.

twist.text: A very high yield can be a red flag. It often means the stock price has crashed and the dividend may be cut.

climax.text: Compare yield to sector averages. A utility at 5% may be normal; a tech stock at 5% deserves scrutiny.

punchline.text: Yield tells you the income rate. Safety tells you if it will last.

quiz.question: How is dividend yield calculated?
options: Annual dividend divided by stock price
